p: Topical analgesics are pain medications applied to the skin. They work in different ways for different conditions but are commonly used to treat musculoskeletal and some types of neuropathic pain ( Kraychete etÂ al., 2016). Oral analgesic and anti-inflammatory drugs are usually prescribed for the treatment of acute and chronic pain and inflammation. These agents often have adverse systemic effects which are sometimes severe. Topical analgesics and anti-inflammatory drugs provide the same relief with reduced adverse systemic effects ( Brayfield, 2018).
